title: Padres reportedly add Valverde on Minor League deal
body: The Padres have signed right-hander Jose Valverde to a Minor League contract, according to a Baseball America report. Valverde, 36, has racked up 288 saves across 12 seasons in the Majors and was most recently a member of the New York Mets. He made 21 relief appearances for the Mets last season, posting a 5.66 ERA before he was released in late May. Valverde is a three-time All-Star, but he hasn't played a full season since 2012. The report also said the Padres have agreed to terms with left-hander Scott Elbert and right-hander Marcos Mateo. William Boor is a reporter for MLB.com. Follow him on Twitter at @wboor. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: William Boor
